title: Watford Boy's football stadium visits
name: Watford Boy's football stadium visits
description:
A Map by Boringlovechild

All the grounds I've been to supporting the Golden Boys from 1979 to the present day.

properties.name: Anfield, Liverpool.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild11th January 2005. Carling Cup Semi-Final First Leg. Jun and I came up by train and stayed in a hotel overnight. We went down 1-0.

properties.name: Craven Cottage, Fulham
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild1st January 2007. Premiership. Joss and I got the train and walked from Hammersmith Station. I thought we were losing for most of the game but realised in the second-half that the early goal had been disallowed. 0-0.

properties.name: Filbert Street, Leicester City
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild15th February 1982. FA Cup fifth round. Dad drove. After the match, which we lost 2-0, one of their fans consoled us with the promotion we looked sure to win and said they\'d take the cup. We agreed.

properties.name: Gay Meadow, Shrewsbury Town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild14th April, 1979. Old League Division 3. Bussed up with Gadeside Rangers, my football team, to see Ian Bolton score our goal in a 1-1 draw in a top-of-the-table clash.

properties.name: Highbury, Arsenal
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild27th November 1982. Old Division 1. John Barnes scored twice as Watford won a thrilling match 4-2. Later we had a house-warming party and Trevor knocked the gas-fire over, setting light to the carpet.

properties.name: Home Park, Plymouth Argyle
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild22nd March 2008, Championship. Rod drove Air, Jun and I down to Devon and Cornwall for the Easter weekend and we got to see the Horns go behind for just three minutes before Lee Williamson equalised with a free kick. They had a man sent off after half-time but didn\'t suffer for it and we finished equal.

properties.name: Kenilworth Road, Luton Town.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild4th March 1985. FA Cup 5th Round. Stood in the terrace of a dump and could only see the right wing for most of the match. 0-0.

properties.name: Loftus Road, Queens Park Rangers.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild18th April 1981. Old Division 2. Dad drove me to the match, which finished 0-0 on their bouncy turf. 22nd September 2007. Championship. Took Joss to see us draw 1-1 and stay top of the league. Adam Johnson (on loan from Middlesbrough) scored.

properties.name: Madejski Stadium, Reading
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSaturday 5th May, 2007. Premiership. Joss, Jun and I travelled by train with Rod and Air to see Watford unexpectedly take all three points. Danny Shittu and Marlon King scored second-hlaf goals in our 2-0 victory.

properties.name: Millennium Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild21st May 2006. v Leeds United. Faisel drove me, Jun, Joss, Nevin and Luke\'s ticket to the great occasion to see the Yellow Army win 3-0 and return to the Premiership.

properties.name: Molineux, Wolverhampton Wanderers.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild16th February 1980. FA Cup 5th Round Dad took me to the evening match and gave me my first sups of beer at half time. Watford won 3-0, Malcolm Poskett scored two and Luther Blissett scored the other.

properties.name: Old Trafford, Manchester United
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild31st January 2007. Premiership. Joss and I travelled up by train to see a 4-0 thrashing and then Deyika picked us up and we stayed at his.

properties.name: Stamford Bridge, Chelsea
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild11th November 2006. Premiership. Joss and I went by train to see us get hammered 4-0. Didier Drogba was on blistering form.

properties.name: The Hawthorns, West Bromwich Albion
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild12th April 2008 Top of the table clash that Joss and I went up to with Jun and stayed at Mum\'s for the night.

properties.name: The Valley, Charlton Athletic
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildÂ 28th January 1984. FA Cup 4th Round. (the old Valley) Dad drove us to see a 2-0 victory, with Johnston and Reilly getting the goals. 21st October 2006. Premiership. Took Joss by train to watch a 0-0 draw. (the new Valley)

properties.name: The Vic, Watford
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildFebruary 3rd 1979: Old League Division 3. Dad asked me a day or two before the match if I supported Watford and wanted to go to the match. Ross Jenkins scored 2 in our 2-2 draw with Rotherham. That season we were promoted and within five we had beaten all the big teams, finished second in the country and got to the FA Cup Final at Wembley. I have been to about 200 games here. My dad brought my sisters and brother once or twice but I went to just about every home game until he died in March 1987. What with university and living and travelling abroad, I had about an eight year break but started going with friends when I returned to the UK (London). Since the early years of the millennium, I\'ve taken three of my nephews, my wife and a few Japanese friends. I have a season ticket in the Rookery.

properties.name: Upton Park, West Ham United
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild27th January 2007. FA Cup 4th Round. Joss, Julie and I saw the Golden Boys progress after winning 1-0. 10th February 2007. Premiership. Joss and I came back two weeks later to see us win by the same score in a six-pointer.

properties.name: Villa Park, Aston Villa
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild14th April 1984. Watford v Plymouth Argyle. FA Cup Semi-Final.Dad drove here and we watched the Golden Boys reach Wembley with a 1-0 victory. George Reilly scored.13th April 2003. Watford v Southampton. FA Cup Semi-Final.Faisel drove me, Jun, Luke and Joss here to see us go down 2-1 to the Saints.20th January 1=2007. v Aston Villa. Premeriship.We came by train and after the match, Joss and I met up with Jun in Birmingham, ate dinner with Tessa and stayed at Pauline and Brian\'s. April 14th 2007 v Manchester United (FA Cup Semi Final) Jun, Joss, Jan and I travelled on a special train to Aston at the end of a week in which United had beaten Roma 7-1. Hameur Bouazza scored a great overhead goal but we went down 4-1.

properties.name: Wembley Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild19th May 1984. Watford v Everton. FA Cup Final. Dad took Trevor and I on the Metropolitan Line to see us go down 2-0. 31st May 1999. Watford v Bolton Wanderers Division One Play-Off Final. Faisel and I went down on the train to see a glorious overhead kick by Nick Wright help us win 2-0. Met up with Asif after the match.

properties.name: White Hart Lane, Tottenham Hotspur
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSpurs v Watford 17th March 2007. Premiership. Joss and I went along to see their keeper score past ours in a 3-1 defeat. Darius Henderson got our late consolation.

properties.name: stadium:mk, Milton Keynes Dons
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildJoss and I went up by train for a preseason friendly (1st August 2007) and found ourselves in a queue that wound round the car park. We missed a fair bit of the first half but the game ended 0-0.
